Description: 3Blue1Brown's visual guide to Linear Algebra, providing intuitive explanations of fundamental concepts like vectors, matrices, and transformations. Long YouTube series that can be watched for free.
Khan Academy's free course on Multivariable Calculus, covering partial derivatives, multiple integrals, and vector calculus. Khan Academy is nonprofit and a free resource.
A YouTube video introducing Calculus for Machine Learning, covering differentiation, gradients, and optimization techniques. Youtube video can be watched for free
”StatQuest by Josh Starmer simplifies complex statistical and probability concepts with engaging explanations and animations. Long YouTube playlist that can be watched for free.”

Coursera's 'Mathematics for Machine Learning' specialization, covering linear algebra, multivariable calculus, and probability/statistics for ML. Uses Tensorflow and Python. Can be audited for free, but requires payment for the full course.
Andrew Ng's famous Machine Learning course on Coursera, covering supervised and unsupervised learning with MATLAB/Octave. Can be audited for free, but requires payment for the full course.
Caltech's Machine Learning course lectures, providing a theoretical foundation for ML concepts and algorithms. Long YouTube playlist that can be watched for free.

Deep Learning Specialization by Andrew Ng, covering neural networks, CNNs, RNNs, and advanced deep learning topics using TensorFlow/Keras and Python. Can be audited for free, but requires payment for the full course.
Fast.ai's Practical Deep Learning for Coders, an application-focused course that teaches deep learning using PyTorch for free.
Harvard's CS50: Introduction to AI with Python, a beginner-friendly course covering search algorithms, optimization, and neural networks. Can be audited for free.
Google's Machine Learning Crash Course, a fast-paced introduction to ML concepts with TensorFlow-based exercises for free
Andrej Karpathy's 'Zero to Hero' series, an in-depth practical guide to neural networks and deep learning from scratch. A long YouTube playlist that can be watched for free.
Stanford CS231n course notes, covering Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and deep learning for visual recognition for free.
Stanford's CS231n lecture videos, providing a deep dive into CNNs, backpropagation, and deep learning architectures. Long YouTube playlist that can be watched for free.
University of Waterloo's lecture on Transformers, explaining attention mechanisms and deep learning models for NLP. Long YouTube video that can be watched for free.
University of Michigan's lecture on Transformers, covering self-attention and the evolution of modern NLP architectures. Long YouTube video that can be watched for free.
”An interactive LLM visualization tool that helps users understand how large language models process text for free”
Financial Times' interactive Transformer explainer, visually breaking down how generative AI models like ChatGPT work for free.
A YouTube video explaining residual learning and how it improves deep neural network training (e.g., ResNets). A long YouTube video that can be watched for free.
Scikit-Learn documentation, covering classic ML models like regression, SVMs, decision trees, and clustering.
TensorFlow tutorials, providing hands-on guidance on deep learning models and deployment with TensorFlow.
PyTorch tutorials, covering model building, training, and optimization using the PyTorch framework.
Kaggle, a platform for ML competitions, datasets, and collaborative learning through shared notebooks.
Google Colab, a free cloud-based Jupyter notebook environment for running Python and ML models.
TensorFlow Playground, an interactive tool for experimenting with neural network architectures and parameters.
Hugging Face Datasets, a repository of high-quality NLP datasets for training and fine-tuning AI models.
"UTMIST website with a list of relevant machine learning courses provided at the University of Toronto."
